The Quranic researcher is in that, that is, when he is mentioned from the story of Pharaoh, what he did and what was done with him is a great lesson for whoever fears, that is, for whom he is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, who is afraid, This is either because whoever is in fear does not need advertising or to include who is afraid of the act and whoever is from him is what was said.
